rationale: The segment does not contain an intensifier or comparative directly modifying a risk-adjective.
The segment reports factual statistics ('Six of the 16 reported human cases have been linked').
The segment does not contain a moderate verb paired with significant scale or impact.
The segment does not contain a loaded rhetorical question.
This segment reports a fact (case source) and lacks explicit calming language.
Segment does not contain a minimiser used with scale contrast.
The segment states cases have been linked to exposure but contains no bare negation.
The segment reports case details, not capabilities or preparedness.
Reports numerical metrics ('Six of the 16 reported human cases') using standard verbs ('linked').
